buildup.text: Vaudeville (1880s-1930s) was variety entertainment: comedy, singing, acrobatics.

discovery.text: Radio brought comedy into homes (1920s-50s). Suddenly comedians needed to be heard but not seen â€” writing and timing.

climax.text: Each medium reshaped comedy: vaudeville valued physical humor, radio valued wit, TV valued character.

punchline.text: Comedy evolves to fit its stage. Change the stage, change the joke.

quiz.question: How did radio change comedy?
